yaak.util
Class StringUtil

java.lang.Object
  yaak.util.StringUtil
public final class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object

StringUtil provides class-level convenience methods for strings.

Version:
$Id: StringUtil.java 6 2005-06-08 17:00:15Z jsmith $
Author:
Jerry Smith

Method Detail

checkValue

public static java.lang.String checkValue(java.lang.String str,
                                          java.lang.String alternateStr)

Accepts a primary string and an alternate/default string. If the first/primary string is not null and has positive length, checkValue() simply returns it; otherwise, it returns the alternate/default string.

Parameters:
str - The primary string.
alternateStr - The alternate/default/back-up/substitution string.
Returns:
The primary string if it has content, otherwise the alternate string.

hasValue

public static boolean hasValue(java.lang.String str)

Tests a string to determine if it has non-zero length, guarding against null values as well.

Parameters:
str - The string.
Returns:
Whether or not the string is both non-null and has length greater than zero.

replace

public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String src,
                                       java.lang.String oldStr,
                                       java.lang.String newStr)

Accepts a primary string and two substitution-related strings. It replaces every occurrence of the first substitution string with the second throughout the primary string.

Parameters:
src - The primary string.
oldStr - The string that will be replaced.
newStr - The replacing string.
Returns:
The modified primary string.

stripSubstring

public static java.lang.String stripSubstring(java.lang.String data,
                                              java.lang.String subData)

Removes the specified substring from the primary string.

Parameters:
data - The primary string.
subData - The substring, all occurences of which are removed from the primary string.
Returns:
The modified primary string.

searchForwardInsensitive

public static int searchForwardInsensitive(java.lang.String str,
                                           java.lang.String searchText,
                                           int offset)

Searches forward in the primary string beginning at the specified offset for the first occurrence of the search string.

Parameters:
str - The primary string.
searchText - The search pattern.
offset - The offset in the primary string where the search begins.
Returns:
The zero-based offset where the matching search pattern begins, or -1 if the pattern is not found.
